issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://chzzk.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchzzk.naver.com) ### Comment > Even after disabling protection, ads still do not appear, and a notification pops up asking if an ad blocker is being used. Even if I turn the program on and off again, this issue occurs frequently. > > 1. Go to the Chzzk website. (https://chzzk.naver.com/) > > 2. Disable AdGuard's ad-blocking protection for the site. > > 3. Observe that ads still do not appear on the site. > > 4. Close Microsoft Edge and reopen it. > > 5. Return to the Chzzk website and notice that the issue persists with a high probability. > > Ads are still blocked. > A notification appears, asking whether an ad blocker is being used. > ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.minkou.jp

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
Hello,
I answered for similar question here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/5f67db19987a0b2467e05d24544933d29b3479cc#commitcomment-155071594
Those "first-party" ads are loaded only if other ads are blocked.
So it's:
>Anti-adblock advertising — alternative advertising displayed on the site when the main one is blocked

and I think that it should not be unblocked (according to reports above, ad block users rather also don't want to see those ads).

If user want to see ads, then he/she can disable ad blocker or add following rule to user rules:
```adblock
@@||royalroad.com^$elemhide,jsinject
```

Have a nice day :)

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://api.komoot.de/v007/mail/c?u=2770381366395&t=weekly_highlight&d=1530](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.komoot.de%2Fv007%2Fmail%2Fc%3Fu%3D2770381366395%26t%3Dweekly_highlight%26d%3D1530) ### Comment > I click on a link from Komoot (a hiking website and app) inside of my email client "eM Client" which opens the link in Microsoft Edge. It worked a long time without problems. But since a few weeks, the mentioned error happens. First I thought the problem is the link (the api) itself, which makes the problems, until I deactivated all my extensions and enabled them one by one, until I got to know, it happens onyl with the enabled adguard extension, which seems to block the api-link. It doesn't matter if adguard is enabled or disabled. > > Error: like you see it in the screenshot. > > This page isn't working at the moment > > If the problem continues, contact the site owner. > > HTTP ERROR 400 Username: `@dxdpxl` ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

It worked a long time without problems. But since a few weeks, the mentioned error happens. First I thought the problem is the link (the api) itself, which makes the problems, until I deactivated all my extensions and enabled them one by one, until I got to know, it happens onyl with the enabled adguard extension, which seems to block the api-link. It doesn't matter if adguard is enabled or disabled. > > Error: like you see it in the screenshot. > > This page isn't working at the moment > > If the problem continues, contact the site owner. > > HTTP ERROR 400 Username: `@dxdpxl` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Thank you for linking to the previous discussion.

So just to make sure I understand, the "anti-adblock advertising" supersedes the overall policies regarding ads ?

I'm specifically referring to this part:

> Our general stance here is very similar to the EasyList policy regarding self-promotion ads. According to our [filter policy](https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/filter-policy/), we should not block these ads; however, we should not make an exception if such an ad gets blocked by some rule 'alongside' a regular ad.

Just for the sake of saving time, here's EasyList's policy regarding self-promotion: 

> Self-promotion (any type of advertising that promotes goods or services that are owned or operated by the domain owner and doesn’t get commercially compensated for by third parties (examples can include new features, new posts, newsletters, subscriptions to printed media products, merchandise etc.)) won't be targeted directly.

The filter I suggested does block the self-promotion "'alongside' a regular ad" (per definition, I consider regular ads the 1st party "user ads" that redirect to a commercial website)

I understand that users are reporting those ads (note that only the 1st and 3rd reports actually report self-promotion), but that's kind of a fallacy (I'd liken it to a survivorship bias), since you don't take into account the people who want to see those "user ads" / "self promotion" (disclaimer, I'm one of those).

If the "Anti-adblock advertising" policy has priority over the self-promotion exception, then that's fine I guess. I just want to clarify things.

Thank you again !

comment.body:
>So just to make sure I understand, the "anti-adblock advertising" supersedes the overall policies regarding ads ?

I don't think that it can be answered in general, rather basing on specific cases.
In this case, if 3rd party ads are blocked, the different ads are loaded (some of them leads to 3rd party websites), so I don't see a reason to not block it. Also it causes that more effort and more complicated rules are required just to unblock ads.

If user want to see ads then can disable ad blocker or add mentioned rule to user rules.
```adblock
@@||royalroad.com^$elemhide,jsinject
```

But I guess that I could unblock first-party ads in `Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion`.

comment.body: @Sergey-Lyapin @Alex-302  Se bloqueó el script war.pe/warp.js, pero este fue creado únicamente para informar a los usuarios que si no tienen Warp activado pueden usarlo de forma gratuita. No contiene trackers ni realiza peticiones externas; solo verifica localmente si hay Warp usando el mismo endpoint de Cloudflare del sitio y muestra un aviso cerrable que solo enlaza a one.one.one.one (página oficial de Cloudflare). El script está alojado en warpe.pages.dev (Cloudflare Pages, solo contenido estático) y el dominio war.pe apunta ahí. El bloqueo afecta una función útil, segura y transparente. Este script no tiene que ver con la situación mostrada en este commit ni con ningún tipo de publicidad, simplemente recomienda al usuario el servicio gratuito de Cloudflare, por favor revisar para considerar revertirlo.

comment.body: @Sergey-Lyapin Se bloqueó el script war.pe/warp.js, pero este fue creado únicamente para informar a los usuarios que si tienen Warp activado pueden usar la web de forma gratuita. No contiene trackers ni realiza peticiones externas; solo verifica localmente si hay Warp usando el mismo endpoint de Cloudflare del sitio y muestra un aviso cerrable que solo enlaza a one.one.one.one (página oficial de Cloudflare). El script está alojado en warpe.pages.dev (Cloudflare Pages, solo contenido estático) y el dominio war.pe apunta ahí. El bloqueo afecta una función útil, segura y transparente, por favor revisar para considerar revertirlo.

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [x] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://chzzk.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchzzk.naver.com) ### Comment > Even after disabling protection, ads still do not appear, and a notification pops up asking if an ad blocker is being used. Even if I turn the program on and off again, this issue occurs frequently. > > 1. Go to the Chzzk website. (https://chzzk.naver.com/) > > 2. Disable AdGuard's ad-blocking protection for the site. > > 3. Observe that ads still do not appear on the site. > > 4. Close Microsoft Edge and reopen it. > > 5. pull_request.title: Fix paperpaper.io
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://paperpaper.io/god-nazad-tysyachi-peterburzhcev-vyrazi/

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Your comment

donation widget

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cdbae241-8fd8-42ca-b941-4103c03af852)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\

> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [x] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;

comment.body:
@AdamWr I'm from Royal Road and we are willing to work with you for the benefit of the AdGuard community and the site. 

Why not set it so that those with AdGuard can only view internal ads? as in ads that link directly to the platform itself and not third party?

It's basically book recommendations at that point and it's a feature our users are interested in. 

In fact our ads are popular enough that if you get a paid premium subscription then you can enable viewing those ads and those ads only, due to popular request. 

Those ads also have no user tracking, and they don’t load external scripts. We only count the total clicks with no user tracking involved, and we serve them randomly. 

If even ads like these can't be allowed on the internet, then what chance does the internet have to remain available for free for users? 

We have modified our script so that in the presence of an ad blocker, we only attempt to load ads that point at stories on the website.

I have already added rules to unblock first party ads in `Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion`.
So those who want to see self-promotion ads can enable this filter list (or rather do not disable it, because if I'm not wrong, it's enabled by default until user changes this option in settings).

issue.title: war.pe
issue.body:
> @Sergey-Lyapin @Alex-302  Se bloqueó el script war.pe/warp.js, pero este fue creado únicamente para informar a los usuarios que si no tienen Warp activado pueden usarlo de forma gratuita. No contiene trackers ni realiza peticiones externas; solo verifica localmente si hay Warp usando el mismo endpoint de Cloudflare del sitio y muestra un aviso cerrable que solo enlaza a one.one.one.one (página oficial de Cloudflare). El script está alojado en warpe.pages.dev (Cloudflare Pages, solo contenido estático) y el dominio war.pe apunta ahí. El bloqueo afecta una función útil, segura y transparente. Este script no tiene que ver con la situación mostrada en este commit ni con ningún tipo de publicidad, simplemente recomienda al usuario el servicio gratuito de Cloudflare, por favor revisar para considerar revertirlo. 

 _Originally posted by @war-pe in [#202464](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/202464#issuecomment-2796686188)_
